intro: Draba tibetica var. chitralensis, commonly known as the Chitral Draba, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 5–15 cm. This species is native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas, including parts of Pakistan and India. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers bloom in early spring, and it has a rosette of basal leaves. The plant is adapted to cold, alpine environments and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils.
